message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CC, cs.CG

This paper deals with the computation of Nash equilibria in games, which is a topic in game theory (cs.GT). The use of action graphs to represent games involves graph theory and combinatorial optimization (cs.DS). The paper also presents a polynomial time approximation scheme (PTAS) for computing mixed Nash equilibria, which involves algorithms and complexity theory (cs.AI). The hardness results for cases with unconstrained treewidth and number of agent types involve computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the use of graphs and networks to model games suggests a possible connection to computational geometry (cs.CG).
